Phrase: Nen-nen-korori, nen-korori.\nThe doll with big ears.\nLet's pat your head.
In place of my daughter.\nPlease play with the crows.
Nen-nen-korori, nen-korori.\nThe doll with beautiful hair.\nLet's pretty you up.
Before the dawn.\nTake the pain somewhere else.
Don't be afraid, don't be afraid.\nYou are a strong and healthy child.
Sick, pain, and scary dreams.\nThey'll all disappear down the river.
Pain, pain, fly away.\nPain, pain, fly away.
Pain, pain, fly away.

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: We're almost at the POI. It looks like we're safe once we're there, but we can't let our guard down yet, so let's be careful.

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: Yoshino, are you alright?

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: It's fine. Was just concentrating.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: Don't worry. This mission will rely on Yoshino's sorcery. Yoshino will do it right. Will be fine.

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: You'll be fine. I'm counting on you.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: Yes. Please do.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: ...Miyako, will always find you.

More than ten days had passed since our encounter with Canaria in M. St. Iris. We, the Special Steel Squad, were in M. St. Iris to plan an investigation into the celestial anomalies occurring in Metro, and to figure out how to establish regular contact with Iris Cloud.

Just as we were about to return to Iris Cloud, a unit of the M. Nishiki Railway Army reported to us after they had completed their mission in M. Nishiki, 'We got separated from Miyako during our withdrawal.'
--They say it is likely that she returned back alone just before the troops withdrew.
Speaking of Miyako, she was instructed to head immediately to another site, saying that she had 'another matter to attend to', after escaping from the old castle in the rain.
According to what I later heard, Miyako is one of the best sorceresses in M Nishiki's railway army, and whenever M. Nishiki had a difficult mission, they would call her back.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: I heard that many torii appeared on the mountain with big barriers. They say that even after the Mist cleared, the torii stayed around.

Name: Queensway
Phrase: I heard they call them 'Senbon Torii', I am not sure if there really are a thousand of them.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: The problem is that a lot of children have been found inside those Senbon Torii".

That was the most puzzling aspect of this incident. The appearance of a large number of torii on the mountain and the Phantom Mist are understandable. However, children disappeared far away from the Senbon Torii and were found at the same place at the same time.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: All the children who were found were safe. Despite the fact that they were wandering around inside the Phantom Mist...

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: Not all of them. There must have been people left behind in the Mist.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: That's why Miyako stayed. Miyako is not afraid of the dark and she is a very kind person.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: ...That's right. She must have returned for a reason.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: Versailles said this. Miyako knows no fear. She can walk in any dark place without using her eyes or ears.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Not only does she have keen senses, but she is also very good at detecting magic.

Name: Putra
Phrase: She's like the Forestiers of Verforet then. I wonder if she has powers similar to those of Rennes or Brittany.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Non. Miyako is not like a Forestier.

Name: Putra
Phrase: What do you mean?

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Rennes and Brittany are professionals at finding people. They don't jump in unplanned in the face of obvious danger. The Forestier train daily, to avoid triggering secondary disasters. If something is too difficult to achieve alone, they will call in their allies to help them.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: ...They would never go into a dangerous place like this alone.
Stop confirmed. The Mist Train stopped at the same time as Paddington's voice.
When Vivienne saw the great number of red torii she could see from the car window, she felt the evilness of the magical power overflowing from them and held her mouth shut.

Name: Queensway
Phrase: This is the Senbon Torii... It's eerie to see so many torii lined up in the mountains.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: It's not just simply eerie. Yoshino is about to throw up.

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: Yoshino, you look really pale. You can't go on a mission like this. It would be better for you to stay on the Train...

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: It's fine. Feels bad, but can still use sorcery. As long as Yoshino can gaman, it's fine.

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: You mean persevere...? Can you fight like this? Can you run away if something bad happens?

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: If Yoshino cannot, would have said to stay on the Train.

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: I understand... but I won't let ya off easy if you're lying.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: If something happens to Yoshino, we should consider withdrawing. I'm worried about Miyako, but without Yoshino, our strength is reduced by half. I don't think we can investigate a place like this without Yoshino's sorcery.

Name: Queensway
Phrase: We wouldn't have been able to solve that treasure hunt mission without Miss Yoshino back then, and we alone are inadequate when it comes to countermeasures against sorcery.

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: Yoshino, tell me what do you think from a quick glance at these pile of torii? Give me your honest opinion as a sorceress.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: Straight to the point, it is very dangerous. Even if there is no Phantom Mist, Yoshino doesn't want to go up this mountain.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: M. Nishiki's Railway Army did not return to look for Miyako even after she was gone. And they've made the correct decision.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: Very certain that something very scary will happen.

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: I see. I understand very well...

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: Well then, let's go, everyone. Keep an eye out for Yoshino's condition as we go. Paddington, please memorise the path for us. It looks very convoluted from down there.

Name: Paddington
Phrase: Yes! Leave it to me!

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: This is no ordinary mountain. But just because we're in M. Nishiki doesn't mean we must rely on Yoshino all the time.
